oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mountain maid with Ma and Grandma

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Women
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; World War, 1914-1918 -- Tennessee -- History;Pall Mall (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three women standing in front of a clapboard building. The woman on the left wears a dotted dress, sweater, and hat. The woman in the center wears a dotted dress, white shoes, and a dark jacket. The woman on the right wears a flowered dress, apron, plaid scarf, and sweater. The caption on the reverse side of the photograph -- "she plucks up courage with ma and granma close by" -- refers to the woman in the center, who was featured in another photograph. (35520.tif)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Albert F. Ganier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pall Mall in Fentress County was Alvin York's hometown. Photographs were taken during a series of meetings between York and Hollywood producers related to a proposed film based on his World War I exploits. Photograph by Albert Franklin Ganier Sr., who captured images of the meetings between York and Warner Brothers as they researched the film, "Sergeant York."
